cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, then turning northwest Wednesday night and approaching the North-South Carolina coast Thursday, with inland motion toward the Mid-Atlantic by Friday-Saturday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast North Carolina coast near Cape Fear

weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Carolina through Virginia and portions of the Mid-Atlantic coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 39–57 mph, higher gusts) possible Friday into early Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft surge possible in lower Chesapeake Bay and tidal rivers if the track remains near or just south of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential 4–8 inches with locally higher amounts leading to flash and river flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large breakers, dangerous rip currents, and possible prolonged freshwater flooding if the storm stalls inland
